subject: Re: [junit] Factory adaptor approach
msgSnippet: ... My concern is twofold: a) You bring testing logic into your production code. It s reasonable to change your design to make it more testable but weaving
messageBody:
> Have other folks used this approach, or something similar? What do you
> all think of this approach to the problem?

My concern is twofold:
a) You bring testing logic into your production code. It's reasonable to
change your design to make it more testable but weaving testing *logic* into
production code feels strange to me.
b) Having more than just one or two of those static factories raises chances
to forget about initializing all override values in setUp and clearing them
again in tearDown.

Johannes
